عن أمـيـر المؤمنـين أبي حـفص عمر بن الخط: On the authority of the Commander of the Faithful, Abu Hafs Umar ibn al-Khattab, may God be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “Actions are but by intentions, and each person will have but what he intended. So whoever migrates for the sake of God and His Messenger, then his migration is for the sake of God and His Messenger. And whoever migrates for some worldly gain or a woman to marry, then his migration is for what he migrated for.”
رواه إمام المحد ثين أبـو عـبـد الله محمد: It was narrated by the Imam of the Hadith scholars, Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Al-Mughira bin Bard Zubaid Al-Bukhari Al-Ja’fi [No. 1] and Abu Al-Hussein Muslim bin Al-Hajjaj bin Muslim Al-Qushayri Al-Naysaburi [No. 1907], may God be pleased with them both, in their two Sahihs, which are the most authentic books compiled.
عن عمر رضي الله عنه أيضا ، قال : بينما ن: On the authority of Umar, may God be pleased with him, he said: While we were sitting with the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, one day, a man with very white clothes and very black hair appeared to us. No trace of travel was visible on him, and none of us recognized him. He sat down next to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and leaned his knees against his knees, and placed his hands on his thighs, and said: “O Muhammad, tell me about Islam.”
فقـال رسـول الله صـلى الله عـليه وسـلـم: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Islam is to bear witness that there is no god but God and that Muhammad is the Messenger of God, to establish prayer, to pay zakat, to fast Ramadan, and to perform Hajj to the House if you are able to do so.”
فعجبنا له ، يسأله ويصدقه ‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‍‌‌‌؟: We were amazed at him, he asked him and he believed him?
He said: Tell me about faith.
قال : أن تؤمن بالله وملائكته وكتبه ورسله: He said: To believe in God, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and to believe in destiny, both good and bad.
He said: Then tell me about ihsan.
قال : ان تعبد الله كأنك تراه ، فإن لم تك: He said: To worship God as if you see Him, and if you do not see Him, then He sees you.
He said: Then tell me about the Hour.
قال : \"ما المسؤول عنها بأعلم من السائل: He said: "The one who is asked about it does not know more than the one who asked."
He said: Tell me about its signs.
قال : \" أن تلد الأم ربتها ، وان ترى الح: He said: “That a mother gives birth to her mistress, and that you see the barefoot, naked, destitute shepherds of sheep competing in building tall buildings.”
ثم انطلق ، فلبثت مليا ،ثم قال :\" يا عمر: Then he left, and I waited a while, then he said: “Omar, do you know who the questioner was?”
I said: "God and His Messenger know best."
قال : فإنه جبريل ، اتاكم يعلمكم دينكم \": He said: It is Gabriel who came to teach you your religion. Narrated by Muslim [No. 8].
عن أبي عـبد الرحمن عبد الله بن عـمر بـن: On the authority of Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah bin Umar bin al-Khattab, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “Islam is built on five: the testimony that there is no god but God and that Muhammad is the Messenger of God, establishing prayer, paying zakat, performing Hajj to the House, and fasting Ramadan.” Narrated by al-Bukhari [No. 8] and Muslim [No. 16].
عن أبي عبد الرحمن عبد الله بن مسعـود رضي: On the authority of Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah ibn Mas`ud, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace - and he is the truthful and believed - told us: “The creation of one of you is gathered in his mother’s womb for forty days as a drop of semen, then he is a clot for a similar period, then he is a lump of flesh for a similar period, then an angel is sent to him, who breathes the spirit into him, and he is commanded with four words: to write down his provision, his life span, his deeds, and whether he will be wretched or happy. By God, other than whom there is no god, one of you may do the deeds of the people of Paradise until there is only an arm’s length between him and it, then the decree will overtake him and he will do the deeds of the people of Hell and enter it. And one of you may do the deeds of the people of Hell until there is only an arm’s length between him and it, then the decree will overtake him and he will do the deeds of the people of Paradise and enter it.” Narrated by al-Bukhari [No. 3208] and Muslim [No. 2643].
عن ام المؤمنين أم عبد الله عـائـشة رضي ا: On the authority of the Mother of the Believers, Umm Abdullah Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever introduces into this matter of ours something that is not part of it, then it will be rejected.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari [No. 2697] and Muslim.
وفي رواية لمسلم : ( مـن عـمـل عـمـلا لـي: In a narration by Muslim: (Whoever does an action that is not in accordance with our command, it will be rejected.)
عن أبي عبد الله النعـمان بن بشير رضي الل: On the authority of Abu Abdullah Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: "That which is lawful is clear, and that which is unlawful is clear, and between the two of them are doubtful matters which many people do not know. So whoever avoids doubtful matters clears himself in regard to his religion and his honour, and whoever falls into doubtful matters falls into that which is unlawful, like a shepherd who pastures his animals near a sanctuary, soon to graze them therein. Beware, every king has a sanctuary, and beware, God's sanctuary is His prohibitions. Beware, in the body there is a morsel of flesh which, if it is sound, the entire body is sound, but if it is corrupt, the entire body is corrupt, and beware, that is the heart." Narrated by Al-Bukhari
عن أبـي رقــيـة تمـيم بن أوس الـداري رضي: On the authority of Abu Ruqayyah Tamim bin Aws Al-Dari, may God be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Religion is advice.”
قال : ( لله ، ولـكـتـابـه ، ولـرسـولـه ،: He said: (To God, His Book, His Messenger, the leaders of the Muslims and their common people) Narrated by Muslim [No. 55].
عن ابن عمر رضي الله عنهما ، ان رسول الله: On the authority of Ibn Umar, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “I have been commanded to fight the people until they testify that there is no god but God and that Muhammad is the Messenger of God, and they establish prayer, and pay zakat. If they do that, then their blood and wealth are safe from me, except for the right of Islam, and their reckoning is with God Almighty.” Narrated by Al-Bukhari [No. 25]
عن أبي هريرة عبد الرحمن بن صخر رضي الله: On the authority of Abu Hurairah Abd al-Rahman ibn Sakhr, may God be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “What I have forbidden you, avoid; and what I have commanded you, do as much of it as you can. Indeed, those before you were destroyed because of their excessive questioning and their disagreement with their prophets.” Narrated by al-Bukhari [No. 7288] and Muslim [No. 1337]
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “God Almighty is good and accepts only that which is good. God has commanded the believers with what He commanded the messengers. God Almighty said: {O messengers, eat from the good things and do righteousness}, and God Almighty said: {O you who have believed, eat from the good things which We have provided for you}, then he mentioned a man who has traveled a long way, disheveled and covered in dust, and who stretches his hands to the sky: O Lord! O Lord! His food is unlawful, his drink is unlawful, his clothing is unlawful, and he has been nourished with unlawful things. So how can his supplication be answered?” Narrated by Muslim [No. 1015].
عن أبي محمد الحسن بن على بن ابي طالب سبط: On the authority of Abu Muhammad al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib, the grandson of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and his beloved, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I have memorized from the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace: (Leave that which makes you doubt for that which does not make you doubt).
رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 2520 ] ، والنسائي [: Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2520] and Al-Nasa’i [No. 5711]. Al-Tirmidhi said: A good and authentic hadith.
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Part of a person’s good Islam is his leaving that which does not concern him.”
حديث حسن ، رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 2318 ] ا: A good hadith, narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2318] and Ibn Majah [No. 3976].
عـن أبي حـمـزة أنـس بـن مـالـك رضي الله: On the authority of Abu Hamza Anas bin Malik, may God be pleased with him, the servant of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself.”
عن ابن مسعود رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Ibn Masoud, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “The blood of a Muslim man [who bears witness that there is no god but God and that I am the Messenger of God] is not permissible to be shed except in one of three cases: a married man who commits adultery, a life for a life, and one who abandons his religion and separates from the community.”
عن أبي هـريـرة رضي الله عـنه ، ان رســول: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent. Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, let him honor his neighbor. Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, let him honor his guest.”
عــن أبـي هـريـرة رضي الله عــنـه ، ان ر: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, that a man said to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace: Give me advice.
قال :( لا تغضب ) فردد مرارًا ، قال : ( ل: He said: (Do not get angry). He repeated it over and over again. He said: (Do not get angry).
عـن أبي يعـلى شـداد بـن اوس رضي الله عـن: On the authority of Abu Ya`la Shaddad bin Aws, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “God has prescribed excellence in all things. So when you kill, kill well, and when you slaughter, slaughter well. Let each one of you sharpen his blade and let his slaughtered animal be merciful.”
عـن أبي ذر جـنـدب بـن جـنـادة ، وأبي عـ: On the authority of Abu Dharr Jundub bin Junada and Abu Abd al-Rahman Muadh bin Jabal, may God be pleased with them, on the authority of the Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “Fear God wherever you are, and follow up a bad deed with a good one, which will erase it, and treat people with good manners.”
رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 1987 ] وقال : حديث: Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 1987] and he said: A good hadith. In some versions: Good and authentic.
عـن أبي العـباس عـبد الله بن عـباس رضي ا: On the authority of Abu al-Abbas Abdullah ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: I was behind the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, one day, and he said: “O boy! I am teaching you some words: Be mindful of God and He will be mindful of you. Be mindful of God and you will find Him in front of you. If you ask, ask God. If you seek help, seek help from God. Know that if the entire nation were to gather together to benefit you with something, they would not benefit you except with something that God has already written for you. If they were to gather together to harm you with something, they would not harm you except with something that God has already written for you. The pens have been lifted.” And the newspapers dried up.
رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 2516 ] وقال : حديث: Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2516] and he said: A good and authentic hadith.
وفي رواية غير الترمذي : ( احفظ الله تجده: In a narration other than Al-Tirmidhi: (Keep God in mind and you will find Him before you. Get to know God in times of ease and He will know you in times of hardship. Know that what missed you was not going to befall you, and what befell you was not going to miss you. Know that victory comes with patience, relief comes with distress, and with hardship comes ease.)
عن أبي مسعود عقبة بن عمرو الأنصاري البدر: On the authority of Abu Masoud Uqbah bin Amr Al-Ansari Al-Badri, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Among the words of the first prophethood that people have grasped is: If you have no shame, then do whatever you want.”
عن أبي عمرو ، وقيل أبي عمرة ؛ سفيان بن ع: On the authority of Abu Amr, and it was said Abu Umrah; Sufyan bin Abdullah Al-Thaqafi, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said: O Messenger of God! Tell me something about Islam that I will not ask anyone else about; he said: (Say: I believe in God, then be steadfast).
عن أبي عبد الله جابر بن عبد الله الأنصار: On the authority of Abu Abdullah Jabir bin Abdullah Al-Ansari, may God be pleased with them both, that a man asked the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: Tell me, if I pray the obligatory prayers, fast Ramadan, make lawful what is lawful, and make unlawful what is unlawful, and do nothing more than that, will I enter Paradise? He said: (Yes).
عن أبي مالك الحارث بن عاصم الأشعري رضي ا: On the authority of Abu Malik Al-Harith bin Asim Al-Ash'ari, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Purity is half of faith, and praise be to God fills the scale, and glory be to God and praise be to God fill – or: fill – what is between heaven and earth, and prayer is light, and charity is proof, and patience is radiance, and the Qur’an is an argument for or against you; all people go out in the morning, selling their souls, either freeing them or destroying them.”
عن أبي ذر الغفاري رضي الله عنه ، عن النب: On the authority of Abu Dharr al-Ghifari, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, in what he narrates on the authority of his Lord, the Blessed and Exalted, that he said: “O My servants, I have forbidden injustice for Myself, and I have made it forbidden amongst you, so do not wrong one another.”
يا عبادي ! كلكم ضال إلا من هديته ، فاسته: O My servants! All of you are astray except those I have guided, so seek guidance from Me and I will guide you.
يا عبادي ! كلكم جائع إلا من أطعمته ، فاس: O My servants! You are all hungry except those whom I have fed, so ask Me for food and I will feed you.
يا عبادي ! كلكم عار إلا من كسوته ، فاستك: O My servants! You are all naked except those whom I clothe, so seek clothing from Me and I shall clothe you.
يا عبادي ! إنكم تخطئون بالليل والنهار ،: O My servants! You sin by night and by day, and I forgive all sins, so seek forgiveness from Me and I will forgive you.
يا عبادي ! إنكم لن تبلغوا ضري فتضروني ،: O My servants! You will never be able to harm Me so as to harm Me, and you will never be able to benefit Me so as to benefit Me.
يا عبادي ! لو أن أولكمم وآخركم وإنسكم وج: O My servants! If the first of you and the last of you, the humans of you and the jinn of you were as pious as the most pious heart of any one man among you, that would not increase My dominion at all.
يا عبادي ! لو أن أولكم وأخركم وإنسكم وجن: O My servants! If the first of you and the last of you, the humans of you and the jinn of you were to be against the most wicked heart of any one man among you, that would not decrease My dominion in the least.

O My servants! If the first of you and the last of you, the humans of you and the jinn of you, were to stand on one plain and make a request of Me, and I were to give everyone what he requested, that would not decrease what I have any more than a needle if dipped into it decreases the sea.
يا عبادي ! إنما هي أعمالكم أحصيها لكم ،: O My servants! It is only your deeds that I count up for you and then recompense you for. So whoever finds good, let him praise Allah, and whoever finds otherwise, let him blame no one but himself.
عن أبي ذر رضي الله عنه أيضا ، أن ناسًا م: On the authority of Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, that some of the companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace: O Messenger of Allah, the wealthy have taken all the rewards; they pray as we pray, and they fast as we fast, and some people give away their surplus wealth in charity. He said: Has Allah not given you something to give in charity? For every utterance of Subhan Allah (Glory be to Allah) is a charity, and every utterance of Allahu Akbar (Allah is Most Great) is a charity, and every utterance of Al-Hamdulillah (Praise be to Allah) is a charity, and every utterance of La ilaha illa Allah (There is no god but Allah) is a charity, and enjoining what is right is a charity, and forbidding what is wrong is a charity, and in some of your deeds there is a charity.
قالوا : يا رسول الله ، أيأتي أحدنا شهوته: They said: O Messenger of God, if one of us satisfies his desire, will he be rewarded for it?
قال : ( أرأيتم لو وضعها في حرام ، أكان ع: He said: (Have you seen if he put it in something forbidden, would he be sinful? Likewise, if he put it in something permissible, he will be rewarded.)
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Every joint of a person must give charity every day the sun rises. Acting justly between two people is charity. Helping a man with his mount, by lifting him onto it or lifting his belongings onto it, is charity. A kind word is charity. Every step you take to prayer is charity. Removing something harmful from the road is charity.”
عن النواس بن سـمعـان رضي الله عـنه ، عـن: On the authority of Al-Nawwas bin Sam’an, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “Righteousness is good character, and sin is that which troubles you in your soul and which you would hate for people to know about.” Narrated by Muslim [No. 2553].
وعن وابصه بن معبد رضي الله عنه ، قال : أ: On the authority of Wabisah ibn Ma’bad, may God be pleased with him, who said: I came to the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, and he said: (You have come to ask about righteousness?) I said: Yes. He said: (Consult your heart. Righteousness is that which the soul finds peace with and the heart finds peace with, and sin is that which troubles the soul and causes hesitation in the chest, even if people give you a fatwa and issue a fatwa).
حديث حسن ، رويناه في مسندي الإمامين أحمد: A good hadith. We narrated it in the Musnads of the two Imams Ahmad ibn Hanbal [4/227] and al-Darimi [2/246] with a good chain of transmission.
عن أبي نجـيـج العـرباض بن سارية رضي الله: On the authority of Abu Nujayj al-Arbadh ibn Sariyah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, preached to us a sermon that made our hearts tremble and brought tears to our eyes. We said: O Messenger of God! It is as if it were a farewell sermon, so advise us. He said: (I advise you to fear God, and to listen and obey even if a slave is appointed over you, for whoever among you lives will see much disagreement. So adhere to my Sunnah and the Sunnah of the hidden, rightly-guided ones, and cling to it firmly. And beware of newly invented matters, for every innovation is misguidance.)
رواه أبو داود [ رقم : 4607 ] والترمذي [: Narrated by Abu Dawood [No. 4607] and Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2676], who said: A good and authentic hadith.
عن معاذ بن جبل رضي الله عنه ، قال : قلت: On the authority of Muadh ibn Jabal (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: I said: O Messenger of Allah! Tell me of an action that will admit me into Paradise and keep me away from the Fire. He said: (You have asked about something great, and it is easy for whomever Allah makes it easy: Worship Allah and do not associate anything with Him, establish prayer, pay zakat, fast Ramadan, and perform Hajj to the House.) Then he said: (Shall I not guide you to the doors of goodness? Fasting is a shield, charity extinguishes sin as water extinguishes fire, and a man’s prayer in the depths of the night.) Then he recited: {Their sides forsake their beds} until he reached {they work} [32 Surah As-Sajdah / verses 16-17]. Then he said: (Shall I not tell you of the head of the matter, its pillar, and the summit of its hump?) I said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah. He said: (The head of the matter is Islam, its pillar is prayer, and the summit of its hump is jihad.) Then he said: (Shall I not tell you of what fills all of that?) I said: Yes, O Messenger of Allah! He took hold of his tongue and said: “Restrain this.” I said: “O Prophet of God, will we be held accountable for what we say?” He said: “May your mother lose you! Are people thrown into the Fire on their faces - or he said: (on their noses) - anything other than the harvest of their tongues?!”
رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 2616 ] وقال : حديث: Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2616] and he said: A good and authentic hadith.
عن أبي ثعلبة الخشني جرثوم بن ناشر رضي ال: On the authority of Abu Tha’labah Al-Khushani Jarthum bin Nasher, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “God Almighty has imposed obligations, so do not neglect them. He has set limits, so do not transgress them. He has forbidden things, so do not violate them. He has remained silent about things out of mercy for you, not out of forgetfulness, so do not search for them.”
حديث حسن ، رواه الدارقطني [(في سننه) 4/: A good hadith, narrated by Al-Darqutni [(in his Sunan) 4/184] and others.
عن أبي العباس سهل بن سعد الساعدي رضي الل: On the authority of Abu al-Abbas Sahl ibn Sa`d al-Sa`idi, may God be pleased with him, who said: A man came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of God! Guide me to an act that, if I do it, God will love me and the people will love me. He said: (Renounce the world and God will love you, and renounce what people have and the people will love you.)
حديث حسن ، رواه ابن ماجه [ رقم : 4102 ]: A good hadith, narrated by Ibn Majah [No. 4102] and others with good chains of transmission.
عن أبي سـعـيـد سعـد بن مالك بن سنان الخد: On the authority of Abu Saeed Saad bin Malik bin Sinan Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “There should be neither harm nor reciprocating harm.”
حديث حسن ، رواه ابن ماجه [راجع رق : 2341: A good hadith, narrated by Ibn Majah [see No. 2341], Al-Darqutni [No. 4/228] and others with a chain of transmission.
ورواه مالك [ 2 / 746 ] في (الموطأ) عـن ع: It was narrated by Malik [2/746] in (Al-Muwatta’) on the authority of Amr bin Yahya on the authority of his father on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, in a mursal form, so he omitted Abu Saeed, and it has chains of transmission, some of which strengthen each other.
عن ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما ، أن رسول الل: On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “If people were given what they claim, some men would claim the wealth and blood of others, but the burden of proof is on the claimant and the oath is on the one who denies.”
حديث حسن ، رواه البيهقي [ في (السنن)10/: A good hadith, narrated by Al-Bayhaqi [in (Al-Sunan) 10/252] and others in this way, and some of it is in (Sahih Al-Bukhari and Muslim).
عن أبي سعيد الخدري رضي الله عنه ، قال :: On the authority of Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may God be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “Whoever among you sees an evil action, let him change it with his hand. If he is unable to do so, then with his tongue. If he is unable to do so, then with his heart, and that is the weakest of faith.”
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Do not envy one another, do not outbid one another, do not hate one another, do not turn your backs on one another, and do not undercut one another. Be, O servants of God, brothers. A Muslim is a brother to a Muslim. He does not wrong him, nor does he abandon him, nor does he lie to him, nor does he look down on him. Piety is here.” And he, may God bless him and grant him peace, pointed to his chest three times. “It is enough for a man to look down on his Muslim brother. Everything of a Muslim is sacred to another Muslim: his blood, his wealth, and his honor.”
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، عن النبي صلى: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, who said: “Whoever relieves a believer of a worldly hardship, Allah will relieve him of a hardship on the Day of Resurrection. Whoever makes things easy for someone in difficulty, Allah will make things easy for him in this world and the Hereafter. Whoever conceals a Muslim, Allah will conceal him in this world and the Hereafter. Allah helps the servant as long as the servant helps his brother. Whoever takes a path in search of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise. No group of people gather in one of the houses of Allah, reciting the Book of Allah and studying it among themselves, except that tranquility descends upon them, mercy covers them, the angels surround them, and Allah mentions them among those who are with Him. Whoever is slowed down by his deeds, his lineage will not hasten him.”
Narrated by Muslim [No.: 2699] with this wording.
عن ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما ، عن رسول الل: On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, in what he narrated on the authority of his Lord, the Blessed and Exalted, he said: “God Almighty has written down the good deeds and the bad deeds, then explained that. So whoever intends to do a good deed but does not do it, God writes it down with Himself as a complete good deed. And if he intends to do it and does it, God writes it down with Himself as ten good deeds to seven hundred times or many times more. And if he intends to do a bad deed but does not do it, God writes it down with Himself as a complete good deed. And if he intends to do it and does it, God writes it down with Himself as one bad deed.”
رواه البخاري [ رقم : 6491 ] ومسلم [ رقم: Narrated by Al-Bukhari [No. 6491] and Muslim [No. 131] in their Sahihs with these letters.
عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه ، قال : قال رس: On the authority of Abu Hurairah, may God be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “God Almighty said: ‘Whoever shows enmity to a friend of Mine, I declare war on him. My servant does not draw near to Me with anything more beloved to Me than what I have made obligatory upon him. My servant continues to draw near to Me with voluntary acts of worship until I love him. When I love him, I am his hearing with which he hears, his sight with which he sees, his hand with which he strikes, and his foot with which he walks. If he asks Me, I will give to him, and if he seeks refuge in Me, I will protect him.”
عن ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما ، أن رسول الل: On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “God has forgiven my nation for mistakes, forgetfulness, and what they are forced to do.”
حديث حسن ، رواه ابن ماجه [ رقم : 2045 ]: A good hadith, narrated by Ibn Majah [No. 2045], Al-Bayhaqi [(Al-Sunan) 7/356] and others.
عـن ابـن عـمـر رضي الله عـنهـما ، قــال: On the authority of Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger, may God bless him and grant him peace, took hold of my shoulders and said: “Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler passing through.”
وكـان ابـن عـمـر رضي الله عـنهـما يقول :: Ibn Omar, may God be pleased with them both, used to say: If you spend the evening, do not wait for the morning, and if you spend the morning, do not wait for the evening, and take from your health for your illness, and from your life for your death.
عن أبي محمد عبد الله بن عمرو بن العاص رض: On the authority of Abu Muhammad Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “None of you truly believes until his desires are in accordance with what I have brought.”
حديث حسن صحيح . رويناه في كتاب ( الحجة ): A good and authentic hadith. We narrated it in the book (Al-Hujjah) with an authentic chain of transmission.
عن انس رضي الله عنه ، قال : سمعت رسول ال: On the authority of Anas, may God be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “God Almighty said: O son of Adam! If you call upon Me and put your hope in Me, I will forgive you for whatever you have done, and I do not mind. O son of Adam, were your sins to reach the clouds of the sky and were you then to ask My forgiveness, I would forgive you. O son of Adam, were you to come to Me with sins nearly as great as the earth and were you to meet Me without associating anything with Me, I would come to you with forgiveness nearly as great.”
رواه الترمذي [ رقم : 3540 ] وقال : حديث: Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi [No. 3540] and he said: A good and authentic hadith.
عن ابن عباس رضي الله عنهما ، قال : قال ر: On the authority of Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “Give the obligatory shares to those entitled to them, and whatever the obligatory shares remain, it goes to the closest male relative.”
عـن عـائشة رضي الله عـنها ، عـن النبي صل: On the authority of Aisha, may God be pleased with her, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “Breastfeeding prohibits what birth prohibits.”
عن جابر بن عبد الله أنه سمع رسول الله صل: On the authority of Jabir ibn Abdullah, that he heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, in the year of the conquest, while he was in Mecca, say: “God and His Messenger have forbidden the sale of wine, dead animals, pork, and idols.” It was said: “O Messenger of God, what do you think of the fat of dead animals, for it is used to coat ships, grease hides, and people use it for lighting their lamps?” He said: “No, it is forbidden.” Then the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, said: “May God curse the Jews, for God has forbidden them fat, but they melted it down, then sold it, and ate its price.”
عن أبي بردة ، عن أبيه أبي أبي موسي الأشع: On the authority of Abu Burdah, on the authority of his father Abu Abi Musa al-Ash'ari, that the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, sent him to Yemen and asked him about the drinks that were made there. He said: “What are they?” He said: “Bit’ and mizr.” It was said to Abu Burdah: “What is bit’?” He said: “Honey wine,” and mizr is barley wine. He said: “Every intoxicant is forbidden.”
عن المقدام بن معد يكرب قال : سمعت رسول ا: On the authority of Al-Muqaddam bin Ma’dikarib, who said: I heard the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, say: “A human being has not filled a vessel worse than his stomach. It is sufficient for the son of Adam to eat a few mouthfuls to keep his back straight. If he must, then a third for his food, a third for his drink, and a third for his breath.”
رواه أحمد [ رقم : 4 / 132 ] ، والترمذي [: Narrated by Ahmad [No. 4/132], Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2380], and Ibn Majah [No. 3349]. Al-Tirmidhi said: It is a good hadith.
عن عبد الله بن عمرو رضي الله عنهما عن ال: On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr, may God be pleased with them both, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “If four things are found in someone, he is a hypocrite, and if one of them is found in someone, then one characteristic of hypocrisy is found in him until he gives it up: if he lies when he speaks, if he breaks his promise, if he behaves wickedly when he disputes, and if he breaks a covenant, he betrays it.”
عن عمر بن الخطاب رضي الله عنه عن النبي ص: On the authority of Omar bin Al-Khattab, may God be pleased with him, on the authority of the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: “If you were to put your trust in God as He should be put, He would provide for you as He provides for the birds. They go out in the morning hungry and return in the evening with full crops.”
رواه أحمد [ رقم : 1/ 30 و 52 ] ، والترمذ: Narrated by Ahmad [No. 1/30 and 52], Al-Tirmidhi [No. 2344], Al-Nasa’i in (Al-Kubra) as in (Al-Tuhfah) [No. 8/79], and Ibn Majah [No. 4164]. It was authenticated by Ibn Hibban (730) and Al-Hakim 4/318, and Al-Tirmidhi said: It is good and authentic.
عن عبد الله بن بسر قال : أتي النبي صلى ا: On the authority of Abdullah bin Busr, who said: A man came to the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, and said: O Messenger of God, the laws of Islam have become too many for us, so is there a comprehensive door that we can hold fast to? He said: (Let your tongue remain moist with the remembrance of God Almighty).
